record.description: [Photographic copy of drawing.] Now under construction at the University of Chicago, the cornerstone for the $2,200,000 International House will be laid tomorrow in a ceremony attended by student representatives of a score of foreign countries. The house is being built with funds provided by John D. Rockefeller Jr. and is intended to provide living quarters for 500 foreign students in Chicago's institutions of higher learning and club facilities for the nearly 2,000 students who are enrolled currently in the city's educational centers.
